duties_responsibilities.duty: Facilitate the daily operations of the registration/admitting/pre-visit area to ensure efficient patient registration.
Assign work duties for efficient registration of patients and maintain employee schedules.
Respond to internal and external customer inquiries and concerns in accordance with Rush policies and procedures.
Direct and coordinate the daily activities of the Patient Access Coordinators for efficient workload management.
Effectively collaborate with subordinates, supervisors, internal, and external customers to achieve departmental and medical center goals.
Recognize process problems, identify opportunities for process improvements, and assist in developing collaborative approaches to resolve the issues.
Acknowledge employee efforts and reward/acknowledge their achievements, provide effective instruction, and administer timely, thoughtful, constructive disciplinary actions when needed.
Complete daily/weekly monitoring in an accurate, constructive, timely manner and compile the data for use in annual performance assessments.
Conduct periodic staff meetings as a way of communicating updates to the staff and instruction on new policies and procedures.

education_certification.credential: Three years supervisory experience in a healthcare-related field, i.e. hospital, physician practice, or clinic.
Comprehensive understanding of the functions of Patient Access within the healthcare field.
Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing to subordinates, superiors, and customers in a variety of ways.
Ability to identify components within a process that require improvements, facilitate the improvement process, and achieve the desired goal of improving the services provided by Patient Access.
